title: snowflake.snowpark.DataFrame.orderBy | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Sorts a DataFrame by the specified expressions (similar to ORDER BY in SQL).

*cols – A column name as str or Column, or a list of
columns to sort by.

ascending – A bool or a list of bool for sorting the
DataFrame, where True sorts a column in ascending order and False
sorts a column in descending order . If you specify a list of multiple
sort orders, the length of the list must equal the number of columns.
